conclusion: Plan to analyze the p-V diagram and apply the ideal gas law to find the temperature at state B.
The image shows a p-V diagram with states A, B, C, and D. A to B is isothermal, B to C is along a hyperbola, C to D is isothermal. Temperature at A is 300 K.
Process A to B is isothermal, so temperature at B is the same as A, which is 300 K.
Process B to C along a hyperbola does not provide temperature change information.
Process C to D is isothermal, but focus remains on A to B for temperature at B.
Since A to B is isothermal and temperature at A is 300 K, temperature at B is also 300 K.
